message.content: This question requires some knowledge about the geological formation of coal. Coal is typically found in mountainous regions where there were once large deposits of plants and organic matter. These deposits were then buried and subjected to heat and pressure, which transformed them into coal. Option (A) is incorrect because coal is not found in icebergs. Option (B) is incorrect because coal is not a form of jewelry. Option (C) is incorrect because coal is not typically found in lakes.
